text: Jacques Brunhes (7 October 1934 â€“ 30 September 2020) was a French politician. He was a member of the French Communist Party. Brunhes was born in Paris. He represented Hauts-de-Seine in the National Assembly from 1978 to 2007. Between 2001 to 2002, he was the Minister of Tourism. Before, between 1987 to 2001, he was Mayor of Gennevilliers. Brunhes died on 30 September 2020 at the age of 85. ==References== Category:1934 births Category:2020 deaths Category:French mayors Category:Politicians from Paris Category:French communists
title: Jacques Brunhes
